title: Vaya Space aims for flight operations next year with STAR-3D vortex hybrid engine
summary: Vaya Space, a developing small satellite and technology company (formerly Rocket Crafters), is deep into the development of their STAR-3D vortex hybrid engine that will be used on the company’s Dauntless rocket.

title: Starlink is now available in 36 countries
summary: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk recently shared that Starlink internet is available in 36 countries. This isn’t just an incredible milestone for SpaceX,...

title: SpaceX test-fires Falcon 9 rocket for Sunday launch from Florida
summary: SpaceX test-fired a Falcon 9 rocket at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center at 9 a.m. EDT (1300 GMT) Saturday in preparation for liftoff Sunday with the company’s next batch of Starlink internet satellites.

title: Watch live: SpaceX preps for Falcon 9 test-firing in Florida
summary: SpaceX is preparing for a test-firing of a Falcon 9 rocket at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center at 9 a.m. EDT (1300 GMT) Saturday in preparation for liftoff Sunday with the company’s next batch of Starlink internet satellites. The rocket’s nine Merlin engines will fire for about seven seconds while hold-down clamps keep the Falcon 9 firmly on the ground at pad 39A. The Falcon 9 is set to lift off Sunday at 9:38 a.m. EDT (1338 GMT) with 53 Starlink internet satellites, marking SpcaeX’s 33rd launch of the year, and the 53rd dedicated launch for the Starlink network. Email the author. Follow Stephen Clark on Twitter: @StephenClark1.

title: SpaceX and Mattel partner to create rocket ship toys to encourage tapping into your inner space explorer
summary: SpaceX and Mattel are partnering to create new rocket ship toys for children. Fast Company noted that the announcement came on the...

title: UK launches consultation on Virgin Orbit launch
summary: The U.K. announced a public consultation July 22 to assess the environmental impact of the country’s first space launch, as part of the licensing process for clearing Virgin Orbit’s mission this year.

title: SCOUT wins defense contract to demonstrate utility of commercial data from sensors in space
summary: Startup SCOUT Space won a Phase 2 Small Business Innovation Research contract from the U.S. Space Force to augment military systems with commercial data from space-based sensors

title: SpaceX breaks 2021 record with 32nd launch of the year
summary: SpaceX broke several records on the Starlink Group 3-2 mission. Launching from Space Launch Complex 4 East (SLC-4E) at the Vandenberg Space Force Base in California, the Falcon 9 Block 5 placed 46 Starlink internet communication satellites into the third shell of the constellation.

title: SpaceX launches 32nd mission of the year, breaking record set in 2021
summary: With the 2022 barely half over, SpaceX launched its 32nd mission of the year Friday from California’s Central Coast, breaking the company’s record for most launches in a year and delivering 46 more Starlink internet satellites into polar orbit to provide global broadband service.

title: Rocket Report: A heavy-lift rocket funded by crypto; Falcon 9 damaged in transport
summary: "EcoRocket Heavy is an ecological, reusable, unprecedentedly low-cost rocket."
